data.title: Side by side terminals
data.body:
On a high resolution monitor the amount of wasted space is huge. 

Please add an option for side by side.

- VSCode Version: any
- OS Version: osx

data.title: Auto Indent breaks indent
Running `clear` in Terminal leaves scrollbar in bad state
data.body:
Testing #29483

- Linux 32 bits

1. Run a few commands in order to get a bunch of output and get that scrollbar going
2. `clear`

Notice how the view is cleared, you can't scroll up, but the scrollbar shows otherwise.

![kapture 2017-06-28 at 10 55 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/27628768-5a6a3ed6-5bf0-11e7-97ec-cd170ec8cdf3.gif)

data.title: Auto Indent doesn't outdent

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.title: Rename Global Task menu to Tasks
data.body: Title says it all.

data.title: The Git Viewlet refreshes when doing file operations outside of the main folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #29176

* on Windows
* open a folder `working_dir` that is using `.git`
* add an unrelated root folder
* in the explorer, copy-paste a file
* observe how the git viewlet refreshes, even though nothing happened in `working_dir`.

fyi @jrieken -- I'm not sure what the root cause of this could be (w.r.t. file events), I would assume the git extension (being correct in the single folder case) would not suffer from this issue.

data.title: In multiple overlapping folders, `ctrl+p` shows duplicates for root files
data.body: Testing #29176 * open `vscode` * add root folder `vscode\src` * search for a file which is not in the recently used section, but which is inside `vscode\src` (at the top) * e.g. `cli.js` * note: if the file is in the recent list it is not duplicated

data.title: In multiple overlapping folders, the label differs from the explorer selection
data.body: Testing #29176 * Open `vscode` * Add root folder `vscode\src` * Open a file from `vscode\src` like `bootstrap-amd.js` * Switch to a different file and then back to `bootstrap-amd.js` * The explorer reveals `vscode\src\bootstrap-amd.js`, while the recent files label indicates that `src` is the "main" root folder for `bootstrap-amd.js`. * I would expect that the label next to `bootstrap-amd.js` show the same root folder that gets revealed in the explorer.

data.title: Windows: Switch Window action is not easily discoverable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: The 'Switch Window' action has been improved and is a very useful action, but it is not easily discoverable on Windows (on OS X the action is shown in the Windows menu).

data.title: Allow pickers to provide an action to show in the pick list
data.body:
This enables actions for those clients that use the picker API and not the heavy quick open handler API.

/cc @dbaeumer

data.title: Cannot rearrange root folders
data.body:
Testing #29176

To have a certain root folder order, today, special care must be taken to open root folders in a specific order. It would make sense to be able to sort them in the Explorer and have them presented in a different order than they were opened.

data.title: Copy/Paste context menu actions on root folders don't work
data.body:
Testing #29176

* open two root folders
* right click copy on one of the root folders
* right click paste on the other root folder
* nothing happens

Perhaps the Copy/Paste actions should not be shown on the root folders ?

data.title: Move lines moves too much
data.body:
Testing #29492

- select a full line by clicking a line number
- move the line up

-> notice that 2 lines are moved, see the attached recording

![move-lines](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27626315-e2b49da8-5be7-11e7-90d7-e16e1e4f5b50.gif)

data.title: Find: input not seeded with current selection
data.body:
Testing #29479

- make a selection inside the terminal
- type CTRL+F to pen the find widget

I would have expected that the find widget is seeded with the current selection, same as is done in the editor.

data.title: Watcher crashes when large folder has lots of changes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #29478
Linux Ubuntu 14, vscode 64 bit

1. Clonse vscode, electron, open both repositories in VS Code
2. while VS Code is open do a `npm install` in electron, and then a `scripts/npm.sh i` in vscode
3. I see the file watcher crashing and all file events after that are ignored for the second repository

Do we have file watcher per repo? If yes then it seems like in this case the file watcher for repository vscode crashed. Could we detect a crash and just restart it?

![screen shot 2017-06-28 at 09 38 10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/27625651-9c472ac2-5be5-11e7-9f2d-436bd974b7f8.png)

data.title: Find: No feedback when there is no match
data.body:
Testing #29479

There is no feedback shown to the user when there is no match of the search string. The find widget in the editor shows 'no results'

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27625743-e4bd7130-5be5-11e7-9dc8-ee54ff9b97c9.png)

data.title: Some file events missing when large workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #29478

Linux ubuntu 14, 64bit vscode

Sometimes I see file events missing (on avarage every other delete event is missing). Here's my repro case

1. Clone electron, vscode repository, open them both in a workspace
2. Delete files outside of VS Code in the electron folder
3. Notice that every other file delete is picked up by the file watcher

data.title: Find: No find history
data.body:
Testing #29479

The find widget in the editor provides a find history (alt+up/alt+down), there is currently no such support in the terminal.

data.title: Add a scratch pad feature
data.body:
A scratch pad is a temporary location or file which is not a part of the project but it is where scratch or dirty codes/files are placed.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Space added when adding newline on beginning of line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0-insider 77bf512f0eba6c7082f5b442ac5de585febcab23 2017-06-19T13:39:50.004Z
- OS Version: 10.12.5 (16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write some code (tested in multiple languages)
2. Place cursor at beginning of line (not the first line)
3. Press "enter" to create a newline
4. Observe strange indentation effects

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes!

![out](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/142784/27622643-3250844a-5b8d-11e7-976f-bb3195e35f7a.gif)

data.title: Suggest: let git support rebase workflow
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win7

**Suggest**
Some people are used to **Pull -> Push** workflow,
and some people are used to **Stash -> Rebase -> Pop -> Push** workflow.

Hope to have a option for the way that git sync changes.

WebStorm is rebase workflow by default.
